text: my name is Jean Rogers and I'm a
principal with ARAP and I'm based in
sustainability and work in the area of
helping organizations and projects um uh
create more sustainable outcomes and to
integrate sustainability strategies into
their core business and operations
And um my sense uh from today and and
from grappling with these issues for
some time now is that um we can take
some hints from the financial markets
that function well when there are clear
signals and that tend to dysfunction
when there's um chaos and no one's
really sure what matters and there's
uncertainty about what regulations will
be put in place And I think that we can
do um all of all of the stakeholders a
great benefit by sending clear signals
about what really matters in terms of
sustainability And if we can get to
those that essence of what those clear
signals are sector by sector then
companies will be able to respond and in
in a rational way they'll be able to
integrate it into their business
strategy and then they will actually
start competing on those things that
matter those sustainability metrics or
attributes or elements um that are
central to their business models And and
that's to me where we need to get to
which isn't a um a stick or a hammer to
say you you must report in this way and
you must report on these things but to
demonstrate that these things matter and
they matter to your stakeholders They
also are central to your business
Competing on them is a good idea and
doing the best you can on these things
is a good idea It's going to be good for
you and it's going to be good for your
stakeholders And once reporting or once
companies start to report on these
things and we start to have a sense of
what are the industry benchmarks because
we we are in this ideal more comparable
world of sustainability reporting Once
that's in the public eye then it's human
nature to want that data to be as best
as it can be If it's out there and
people are looking at it you are going
to manage it You are going to focus on
it Uh and and drive performance and and
after all it's really about driving
performance and more sustainable outcome
It's not just about who gets the best
the gold medal for the best report but
who gets the gold medal for the the best
sustainability performance And that's
really where we want to get to There are
problems to be overcome but the good
news is they are all manageable And
really it is this idea that um you're in
a business you make things or you do
things uh and you create value for
shareholders but in doing so you do have
impacts You use human capital you use
natural capital So managing those things
well is good for your business And it's
really as simple as looking at not at
100 sustainability indicators and trying
to pick well what seems to make sense
Look at your core business and think
about what impact do you have That's the
best place to start And I think the
problems have been that companies are
just struggling with with um everything
that's out there and looking for the
answer outside you know and looking for
you know tell us you know what matters
They're not looking inside They're not
just looking at what do we do every day
and what are the impacts that we have
and how can we do that better and those
are the things that matter So if I'm a
car manufacturer it the fuel efficiency
in my fleet matters and and that that's
being integrated into product design and
pricing strategy and market strategy and
and all of that that that's central
You're you're an automobile manufacturer
It's not that you recycled paper in the
office or that you had organic food in
the cafeteria You know they say you know
it's just and sometimes you hear
companies talk about these things even
at analyst meetings that they're they're
they're not relevant They're not
material It's not no wonder that
everybody's frustrated with it because
you know it's not making sense in terms
of the company's business strategy So
the best way to decide overcome the
challenge is to look at what is our
business strategy Is that a sustainable
business strategy And are we managing
resources to the best of our ability and
not only minimizing impacts but um
maximizing opportunities that are out
there and those companies that see that
will be the winners Okay
